parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Condemnation, censure. From katakrino; sentencing adversely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To tell (say) beforehand, forewarn, declare, tell plainly. From pro and lego; to say beforehand, i.e. Predict, forewarn.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
To live together with. From sun and zao; to continue to live in common with, i.e. Co-survive.
To die together with. From sun and apothnesko; to decease in company with, or, similarly to.
